title: Read this
body:
I'm going to state something obvious here.

Us humans have gone thousands of years of surviving in the wild, hunting food and fighting to the death for our mere survival.

I'm going to be blunt, if you get upset because of "bullying" online, you really shouldn't be playing LoL. More specifically you shouldn't be online at all. The internet is not a kindergarten. More specifically if you cannot manage to mute someone before they "upset" you then you probably got mental health issues or just a weak minded person. 

LoL is a competitive game, people get competitive and emotions are high. If someone calls you bad, maybe there is truth to it? And most importantly if it truly upsets you perhaps you should use your IQ 70 to press tab and select mute.

I really don't understand how our male race how scooped so low to such a poor pool of genetics. When did humans become so fragile and weak?? It makes me pretty disgusted tbh.

I will leave with saying intentionally feeding is different. That ruins games.

Verbal abuse is a choice YOU ACCEPT to tolerate. Reporting them makes you look pathetic and weak, pretty much a beta. If you report people for "verbal abuse", natural selection failed with you basically. 

This isn't even a troll post, I'm 110% serious.

replies.body: bravo Sekai and Mozzie25, great responses =D Thank you for being a sportsmanlike influence in our community.

If you're so tough, why don't you go live in the wild instead of hiding on man-made systems like internet and claiming that it's the wild wild west or whatever it is you think it is?

Humans also get this thing over the years you know, it's called civility. And we expect people to be civil to each other. It's not much to ask. I mean, to use your own flow of logic, if you're so tough, why don't you just suck it up when others are telling you off?

Don't worry, I can answer this for you. Because just like the "realists" who tend to talk pettily small, some of us instead like to talk big, very big. Those packs can only debate while dressing their personal beliefs as bigger than it should be, hiding behind an overarching and grandiose "concerns" of whatever to appear that they have the superior stance, and hope to beat people with buzzwords while putting little thought behind the legitimacy of the rationale as well as its implications. Those people like to pretend that being a barbarian, a brute, a beast is the be all and end all of all things. Those people are so concerned with "oh people are so weak" they can't help but to bully and assault others because being a madman, an non-empathetic grunt, or an uncultured fuck is such a superior way of living, because humans used to be "so strong".

Because god forbid humility, grace, rationality, intelligence, moral and ethics, empathy, general damn decency etc and **ACTUALLY TAKING RESPONSIBILITY FOR YOU ACTIONS**, no no no they ain't no strength, noooooo the might makes right eh bois? We might as well say a person who attacks and spout crap at another is obviously not at fault, no mate, it's the victim's fault for being there that triggers the aggressor, right fellas?

.............................

There's more to it than your muscle mass and the thickness of your skin. There CAN be truth in it if someone is telling you that you're trash, it absolutely can, but the thing is, there are better ways to express that without outright attacking the person you're talking to as that neither helps their situation and neither will help you. It's a very simple logic, because people don't like being attacked for no reason (and why should they? Do you?), so you don't attack them, and that can get your point across equally as well, so why not do it? Is showing off how tough you supposedly are that important?

The usage of force is not inherently wrong, I don't believe anyone would argue the otherwise, but it's a matter of fact that force are often misused to forward and abuse a personal stance at the expense of others. This OP is one of the examples.

It's 1 thing to criticise others for being thin-skinned, it's however another topic entirely to try and justify being a dickbag and disassociating bad behaviours from taking responsibilities as you are now.

I actually read your entire response. You completely missed my point.

You are opposing I cannot express my verbal free will. It might even be a generalised observation that you call someone trash. The question is, who are you or any other person in this world to tell me what I can and cannot say.

You even have a mute future embedded into your client but you take it on your stride to report someone because you're a BETA-male (Basically an emotional little bitch). We survived thousands of years to become some form of subhuman emotional trash. A truly pathetic herd. It really worries me how feminine men are nowadays, cannot even tolerate a bit of smack competitive talk.

And lets pretend someone tells you to self harm, why is that toxic? You have the choice to do it, nobody is making you. Are we humans truly that pathetic that words upset you THAT much? Someone could say the worst of the worst things about me and my family and I wouldn't care.... Why? Because I DON'T care. I'm not some pathetic little mental patient who needs validation and emotional hand holding online. 

Get a grip on reality, mate.

You don't get to tell people what they should be offended by. And if you think what sometimes goes in in league is smack talk you are sadly mistaken. Some of the less insulting things I've heard in league would get you cautioned in a physical sport. The worst incidents would get you banned. Just cause your anonymous on the internet doesn't mean you get to act like an asshole and blame people when they call you on it. 

Humanity hasn't gotten weaker. We just aren't putting up with the same bullshit. If you need to call others Betas to make yourself feel big you clearly care more about what people say than your telling yourself. 

Telling people to kill themselves Is a literal crime. People being upset by words isn't pathetic. You thinking calling people betas and abusing them makes you strong is pathetic.

> [{quoted}](name=Evelynnn,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=6FyyjBog,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2017-05-01T16:13:13.554+0000)
>
> You are opposing I cannot express my verbal free will. It might even be a generalised observation that you call someone trash. The question is, who are you or any other person in this world to tell me what I can and cannot say.


If you're going to try and hide behind Freedom of Expression, let's just take a moment to clarify something here. 

Under the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights (which the Australian Human Rights Commission upholds), _**everyone shall have the right to freedom of expression; this right shall include freedom to seek, receive and impart information and ideas of all kinds, regardless of frontiers**_.

In a nutshell, it means you're entitled to an opinion. Nobody can take that from you, and nobody can stop you expressing it.

What it doesn't mean is that you have a right to be a dick. It doesn't mean anybody needs to respect your opinion. And for someone whose original post was calling on everyone else to be an intelligent adult, you're certainly taking a childish approach here.

This is not really about freedom of speech — it's about you desire to say things about specific groups of people, while at the same time refusing to allow them to respond.

It says a great deal about your lack of maturity when you demand the right to say whatever you like, but at the same time demand no-one should be able to answer back.

While not everyone can express (or even understand) what it means to feel empathy, it's not hard to learn to be considerate. There's one simple step - just don't be a dick.

You're saying verbal abuse is something people choose to tolerate. Under that same vein of thought, being abusive is something you choose to embody. You've made a conscious decision to be a dick to other people, and then decided you have a right to get upset when other people are upset by it?

That's a right you don't have. Others do have a right to tell you what you can and can't say. It's why we have defamation laws and discrimination laws. It's why every workplace in Australia has anti-bullying and harassment policies. It's why cyberbullying is actually a crime. 

Those laws tells us that you don't get to tell people that if they don't want to be insulted they should stay off the internet, or not play League.

And no, it's not a denial of your freedom of expression, it's just called being a grown-up.

I always figured that you have freedom of speech until that speech becomes about abusing, harassing or provoking harm against another human being. Your right to freedom of speech doesn't override their rights. People wave around freedom of speech and religion like it's some magical banner which means they can do anything they want. When it's nothing of the sort, drives me absolutely nuts. Doesn't matter what freedom of right your talking about it doesn't override other people's rights.

Read it. And guess what. Your alpha/beta bullsh*t is exactly the reason the world is in the state it is right now. If people realised that no person is better than another person, that we're all human, we wouldn't be sending our troops into places like Mosul, because we wouldn't need troops in the first place. We wouldn't be marching in the streets, proclaiming our human rights, because we'd already have them. And most of all, we wouldn't have to tolerate the toxicity of people like you, because we'd all recognise that we're all imperfect.

Two things. 

1. We don't accept this kind of shitty behaviour in person so why should we accept it in LOL? You're responsible for your actions. Trying to push the blame onto the people being verbally abused is stupid and harmful. 

2. If you subscribe to that alpha, beta bullshit; your the problem, not the rest of humanity. Humanity hasn't gotten weaker, we just aren't tolerating some of the bullshit that was ok a couple of decades ago.

oh please, if you cant handle being insulted, go to the ACT with the other pansy's who think they get the plague if they get offended, if you cant handle it then you shouldn't ever interact with other people,

Bullshit. This isn't about anyone being weak this about you wanting to behave like an asshole without anyone calling you in it. 

It ain't happening. It's not tolerated in regular society and it's not gonna be tolerated here.

I'm just gonna be on the neutral side here and address points in each favour

1. Getting upset over some words someone has said to you over the internet is pretty pathetic, the mute button exists for a reason, and even if it isn't on LoL, there is always a thing called putting you phone down/closing your laptop. Looking back at the last generation compared to ours, it's pretty sad how weak and pathetic people have become. People back then didn't even have the internet, everything insulting was told right to their face, yet in our day and age getting upset over the words "kill yourself" said by some random person on the other side of the world that you probably have never seen or know. For all we know the person saying that could be some 12 year old immature brat. So basically, get over it, stop taking anything online seriously.

2. Yes LoL is a competitive game, but that doesn't entitle you to swear and be rude to your teammates, you think you're helping by calling your botlane "autistic"? You think that's gonna give them a boost of self esteem and make them play better for the rest of the game? No. Reporting someone does not make you look pathetic and weak, reporting someone helps rat out the fuckwits in the community that do nothing but decide to be shitheads all game, wasting time arguing back and forth instead of actually playing the damn game. You'd think after about 100 games of constant arguing they would learn a lesson but no, back to being a keyboard warrior instead of helping take drag or pushing a lane. You have every right to report someone for that, and they deserve to be banned.

Our Male Race? females don't exist?

Thousand years? Try Millions.

110% is mathematically incorrect... do you have an IQ below 70? or maybe you're the disabled one? (your attitude supports this) :D

Its not a case of choosing to tolerate abuse, we don't choose to tolerate it, we choose what we do about it in some cases this means muting (as mentioned) however abuse should be intollerable and reporting doesn't make you weak or pathetic, it means you're looking out for other players so they don't have to deal with the shit that you may just have dealt with.

We're all gamers, we're all human, most of us are here to escape the shit that life throws at us thus abuse is intolerable, we already have to deal with that day-to-day.

The idea of community is to support one another, if that means reporting someone for being an ass so be it. No single individual should have to deal with %%%%s

If anyone here is a beta, its you, your close-mindedness is why the world is how it is...
